intro: Caulanthus crassicaulis, commonly known as the broadstemed silversword, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Caulanthus crassicaulis is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
